title: Authors and Citation
text: Vituri G (2022). TDAtools: TDA + Mapper tools interface. R package version 0.1.0.
code: @Manual{,   title = {TDAtools: TDA + Mapper tools and interface},   author = {Guilherme Vituri},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 0.1.0}, }

title: TDA + Mapper tools and interface
text: TDAtools provides many functions help data scientists using TDA.

title: TDA + Mapper tools and interface
text: can install development version TDAtools GitHub :

title: TDA + Mapper tools and interface
text: Let’s fix notation: X data.frame numeric , possibly, factor columns. needed, select numeric columns (like calculating distance matrix X) denote X. rows X called observations, columns called variables; f_X vector one number observation X. : f_X result applying filter function f : X → ℝ X. provide many filter functions; distance_matrix matrix distances calculated X function applied X results matrix

title: TDA + Mapper tools and interface
text: provide Mapper algorithm Ball-Mapper algorithm. return list consisting : graph weighted vertices; list showing points X vertex. See vignettes examples. (-)

title: TDA + Mapper tools and interface
text: Let X sample random points noisy circle: Let filter function projetion x-axis let color X using :  Now embed X R4: calculate Mapper Graph: result list many objects. example, pullback interval covering: Let’s plot mapper graph:  , better visualization, use networkVis package color nodes using mean value x variable X:  color y:
code: library(TDAtools) #> Carregando pacotes exigidos: shiny #> Carregando pacotes exigidos: dplyr #>  #> Attaching package: 'dplyr' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union #> Carregando pacotes exigidos: purrr #> Carregando pacotes exigidos: ggplot2  X = data.noisy_circle() f_X = X$x  color_band = ggplot2::cut_interval(f_X, n = 50) col_vector = viridis::viridis(nlevels(color_band))[as.integer(color_band)] plot(X, col = col_vector) X$z = 0 X$w = 0 mp =   mapper(     X = X     ,f_X = f_X   ) #> Clustering pullback 1... #> Clustering pullback 2... #> Clustering pullback 3... #> Clustering pullback 4... #> Clustering pullback 5... #> Clustering pullback 6... #> Clustering pullback 7... #> Clustering pullback 8... #> Clustering pullback 9... #> Clustering pullback 10... mp$pullback |> str() #> List of 10 #>  $ 1 : int [1:77] 7 39 58 62 67 68 76 86 89 100 ... #>  $ 2 : int [1:256] 1 2 5 7 10 16 18 19 21 25 ... #>  $ 3 : int [1:303] 1 2 5 9 10 16 17 18 19 21 ... #>  $ 4 : int [1:199] 9 17 23 24 31 33 36 37 41 44 ... #>  $ 5 : int [1:164] 20 29 35 36 37 41 42 43 44 46 ... #>  $ 6 : int [1:180] 3 4 6 11 20 26 29 30 35 42 ... #>  $ 7 : int [1:194] 3 4 6 11 12 15 26 27 30 34 ... #>  $ 8 : int [1:272] 8 12 15 22 27 32 34 38 40 48 ... #>  $ 9 : int [1:262] 8 13 14 22 28 32 38 40 47 49 ... #>  $ 10: int [1:93] 13 14 28 47 61 91 105 108 111 126 ... #>  - attr(*, "class")= chr "AsIs" mp$graph %>% plot() mp %>% plot_mapper() mp %>% plot_mapper(data_column = 'y')

title: TDA + Mapper tools and interface
text: Vignettes using mapper factor variables Ball Mapper documentation Persistent homology examples Data analysis using vertices mapper + machine learning

title: Ball mapper — ball_mapper
text: D matrix distances. epsilon non-negative number. id possible subset indexes D.

title: DBScan clustering function — clust.dbscan
code: clust.dbscan(   distance_matrix,   epsilon = 1,   min_points_per_cluster = 1,   border_points = TRUE,   put_all_outliers_in_a_single_cluster = FALSE,   ... )

title: HDBScan clustering function — clust.hdbscan
code: clust.hdbscan(   distance_matrix,   n_points_dist = NULL,   min_pts_per_cluster = NULL,   min_percent_points_per_cluster = 5,   put_all_outliers_in_a_single_cluster = FALSE )

title: Noisy circle data — data.noisy_circle
text: n amount points sample. radius radius circle. sd standard deviation.

what: Distance from a point x to a set X — dist_point_to_set
title: Distance from a point x to a set X — dist_point_to_set
Distance from a point x to a set X — dist_point_to_set
Distance from a point x to a set X — dist_point_to_set
Distance from a point x to a set X — dist_point_to_set
text: vector size x, corresponding distance x element X.

what: Farthest point sample of a set — farthest_points_sample
title: Farthest point sample of a set — farthest_points_sample
Farthest point sample of a set — farthest_points_sample
Farthest point sample of a set — farthest_points_sample
text: X dataframe matrix points. p amount points procedure.

what: Calculate the mapper graph of a set — mapper
title: Calculate the mapper graph of a set — mapper
Calculate the mapper graph of a set — mapper
code: mapper(   X = data.noisy_circle(),   distance_matrix = stats::dist,   f_X = X[1, ],   covering = cover.uniform,   clustering_function = clust.first_cutoff )

title: Calculate the mapper graph of a set — mapper
text: X dataframe matrix. distance_matrix dist object matrix distances; function return object applied X. f_X numeric vector length equal rows X; function return vector applied X. covering matrix intervals function returns matrix. clustering_function clustering function.

title: Calculate the mapper graph of a set — mapper
Calculate the mapper graph of a set — mapper
code: mp = mapper() #> Error in validObject(.Object): invalid class “Intervals” object: The 'Intervals' classes are based on two-column, numeric matrices. mp %>% plot_mapper() #> Error in plot_mapper(.): object 'mp' not found

what: Plot the mapper graph interactively — plot_mapper
title: Plot the mapper graph interactively — plot_mapper
Plot the mapper graph interactively — plot_mapper
code: plot_mapper(   mp,   data_column = names(mp$data)[1],   color_vertex_by = f,   color_scale = viridis::viridis(10) )

what: Split the pullback of a covering — split_pullback
title: Split the pullback of a covering — split_pullback
Split the pullback of a covering — split_pullback
code: split_pullback(   pullback,   data = NULL,   X = NULL,   distance_matrix = NULL,   distance_function = stats::dist,   clustering_function = clustering_hdbscan )
